channel.title: Comments on: How to rename a column in a SQL Server table without using the designer
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: You can't really, you would either need a tool that will fix it for you like DataDude or do this on staging and do some regression testimng there to identify all the objects that refernce this...for all you know you might also have some ad-hoc SQL in apps that will break.....this is also why people in general don't rename stuff even if the column name is misspelled<br />
item.content:encoded: You can’t really, you would either need a tool that will fix it for you like DataDude or do this on staging and do some regression testimng there to identify all the objects that refernce this…for all you know you might also have some ad-hoc SQL in apps that will break…..this is also why people in general don’t rename stuff even if the column name is misspelled

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: Once you renamed the column, how would you automatically fix all references to this column?
item.content:encoded: Once you renamed the column, how would you automatically fix all references to this column?
